description.zh-cn: 位于东南亚的岛国和城邦，前英国殖民地，曾短暂加入马来西亚联邦，后于1965年独立建国。
description.en: An island country and city-state in Southeast Asia. Formerly a British colony, it briefly joined the Federation of Malaysia before becoming an independent nation in 1965.

description.zh-cn: 英国不列颠东印度公司雇员，在新加坡建立交易站和殖民地，被视为现代新加坡的开埠者。
description.en: An employee of the British East India Company who established a trading post and colony in Singapore, considered the founder of modern Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 一家英国的特许公司，曾在19世纪初管辖新加坡地区。
description.en: A British chartered company that administered the Singapore area in the early 19th century.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡在1824年至1963年间的宗主国。
description.en: The sovereign state of Singapore from 1824 to 1963.

description.zh-cn: 在第二次世界大战期间占领新加坡的国家。
description.en: The country that occupied Singapore during World War II.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡于1963年至1965年间曾加入其联邦，成为新加坡州。
description.en: Singapore was a state within its federation from 1963 to 1965.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡首任总理，在新加坡与马来西亚合并及分离时期担任关键政治角色。
description.en: The first Prime Minister of Singapore, who played a key political role during the periods of Singapore's merger with and separation from Malaysia.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡的长期执政党，由李光耀领导，在与马来西亚联邦政府的政治较量中扮演核心角色。
description.en: The long-ruling party of Singapore, led by Lee Kuan Yew, which played a central role in the political struggle with the Malaysian federal government.

description.zh-cn: 马来西亚的执政党之一，在新加坡处于马来西亚联邦期间与人民行动党存在政治对立。
description.en: One of Malaysia's ruling parties, which had a political rivalry with the People's Action Party while Singapore was part of the Malaysian Federation.

description.zh-cn: 时任马来西亚首相，下令将新加坡州自马来西亚联邦中除名。
description.en: The Prime Minister of Malaysia at the time, who ordered the removal of the State of Singapore from the Federation of Malaysia.

description.zh-cn: 马来西亚的立法机构，通过修宪将新加坡驱逐出联邦。
description.en: The legislative body of Malaysia, which expelled Singapore from the federation through a constitutional amendment.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡现任总统。
description.en: The current President of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡现任总理。
description.en: The current Prime Minister of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡现任国会议长。
description.en: The current Speaker of the Parliament of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡现任首席大法官。
description.en: The current Chief Justice of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡的军事力量，与台湾和以色列有紧密的军事合作关系。
description.en: The military forces of Singapore, which have close military cooperation with Taiwan and Israel.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡“星光部队”的训练地点。
description.en: The training location for Singapore's 'Starlight' military units.

description.zh-cn: 在军事上与新加坡关系紧密，曾派遣军官指导新加坡军队的建立。
description.en: Has close military ties with Singapore and once sent military officers to guide the establishment of the Singaporean army.

description.zh-cn: 前中华民国总统，与李光耀私交甚笃，促成了新加坡军队赴台训练的合作。
description.en: Former President of the Republic of China who had a close personal friendship with Lee Kuan Yew, which facilitated the military cooperation for Singaporean troops to train in Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡游泳运动员，为新加坡赢得史上首枚奥运金牌。
description.en: A Singaporean swimmer who won Singapore's first-ever Olympic gold medal.

description.zh-cn: 美国游泳运动员，在2016年奥运会男子100米蝶泳决赛中与另外两位选手并列第二，负于约瑟·斯库林。
description.en: An American swimmer who tied for second place with two other competitors in the men's 100m butterfly final at the 2016 Olympics, losing to Joseph Schooling.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡羽毛球运动员，为新加坡获得首枚羽毛球世锦赛金牌。
description.en: A Singaporean badminton player who won Singapore's first-ever badminton world championship gold medal.

description.zh-cn: 1819年，任职于英国不列颠东印度公司的斯坦福·莱佛士登陆新加坡，并获准在此建立交易站和殖民地，开启了现代新加坡的历史。
description.en: In 1819, Stamford Raffles, an employee of the British East India Company, landed in Singapore and was permitted to establish a trading post and colony, marking the beginning of modern Singapore's history.

description.zh-cn: 自1824年起，新加坡正式成为英国殖民地，直到1963年加入马来西亚联邦才完全脱离英国统治。
description.en: From 1824, Singapore officially became a British colony, and only fully broke away from British rule when it joined the Federation of Malaysia in 1963.

description.zh-cn: 在太平洋战争期间，日本占领新加坡，并将其更名为“昭南岛”，中断了英国的统治。
description.en: During the Pacific War, Japan occupied Singapore, renaming it 'Syonan-to' and interrupting British rule.

description.zh-cn: 1963年，新加坡以独立城邦的形式加入马来西亚联邦，成为新加坡州。
description.en: In 1963, Singapore joined the Federation of Malaysia as an independent city-state, becoming the State of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 在新加坡并入马来西亚期间，李光耀与马来西亚联邦政府在种族权利分配上意见不合，反对“马来人至上”政策，导致政治对立。
description.en: During Singapore's time in Malaysia, Lee Kuan Yew disagreed with the Malaysian federal government on the allocation of racial rights and opposed the 'Malay supremacy' policy, leading to political antagonism.

description.zh-cn: 人民行动党与执政的马来民族统一机构（巫统）之间的政治较量在1964年两次引发新加坡种族骚乱。
description.en: The political struggle between the People's Action Party and the ruling United Malays National Organisation (UMNO) led to two race riots in Singapore in 1964.

description.zh-cn: 马来西亚国会通过紧急修宪，将新加坡驱逐出联邦，从而促使新加坡独立建国。
description.en: The Malaysian Parliament passed an emergency constitutional amendment to expel Singapore from the federation, thereby pushing Singapore to become an independent nation.

description.zh-cn: 时任马来西亚首相东姑阿都拉曼下令将新加坡州自马来西亚联邦中除名，是新加坡被迫独立的关键一步。
description.en: Then-Prime Minister of Malaysia Tunku Abdul Rahman ordered the expulsion of the State of Singapore from the Federation of Malaysia, a critical step towards Singapore's forced independence.

description.zh-cn: 担任新加坡共和国总统，为国家元首。
description.en: Serves as the President of the Republic of Singapore, the head of state.

description.zh-cn: 担任新加坡总理，为政府首脑。
description.en: Serves as the Prime Minister of Singapore, the head of government.

description.zh-cn: 担任新加坡国会议长。
description.en: Serves as the Speaker of the Parliament of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 担任新加坡首席大法官。
description.en: Serves as the Chief Justice of Singapore.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡军队与台湾有合作关系，将其被称为“星光部队”的军队移至台湾进行训练。
description.en: The Singapore Armed Forces has a cooperative relationship with Taiwan, sending its troops, known as the 'Starlight Force', to train in Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 新加坡与以色列的军事关系紧密，其军队的建立曾受到一批以色列军官的亲自指导。
description.en: Singapore and Israel have close military relations; the establishment of the Singaporean army was personally guided by a group of Israeli military officers.

description.zh-cn: 蒋经国与李光耀的私交甚笃是促成新加坡军队移至台湾训练的重要原因之一。
description.en: The close personal friendship between Chiang Ching-kuo and Lee Kuan Yew was one of the key reasons for facilitating the training of Singaporean troops in Taiwan.

description.zh-cn: 在2016年夏季奥运会男子100米蝶泳决赛中，约瑟·斯库林以破奥运纪录的成绩击败迈克尔·菲尔普斯等人，赢得金牌。
description.en: In the men's 100m butterfly final at the 2016 Summer Olympics, Joseph Schooling defeated Michael Phelps and others with an Olympic record-breaking time to win the gold medal.

description.zh-cn: 羽毛球选手骆建佑为新加坡获得首枚羽毛球世锦赛金牌，提升了国家在体育领域的声誉。
description.en: Badminton player Loh Kean Yew won Singapore's first-ever Badminton World Championships gold medal, enhancing the nation's reputation in the field of sports.
